Speaker: Mr MENZIES
Title: Unknown
text: I move:That the honourable member for Corangamite (Mr MCDonald) do take the chair o l this. House as Speaker.

Title: Unknown

Speaker: Mr MCDONALD
Title: Unknown

Speaker: Mr MENZIES
Title: Unknown
text: Kooyong-Leade r of the Opposition) [2.37] - The Opposition has submitted the nomination of the honourable member for Corangamite , (^ MCDonald) for the Speakership of this House, not because it entertains some such fanciful idea as that the numbers will be with it in the ballot, but because siders that it ought to seize this opportunity to say one or two things about the C l e r k Speakership. We believe, and imagine that all honourable members will believe, that it is the function of Mr Speaker to be scrupulously impartial in his treatment of both sides of the House. All honourable members who were in the last Parliament will recall that on, at any rate, two occasions, it became necessary for the members of the Opposition to put into formal shape their protest against rulings given by Mr.. Speaker in that Parliament, and against what they believe; to be his partial treatment of members of the House. That iswhy we take this opportunity of submitting a candidate in opposition to the honourable member for Dalley (Mr Rosevear). I want to say right away, so that there may be no confusion about, this discussion, that our attitude on this matter,, and the protest upon which we build it,, are not in any day due to some personal, hostility to the honourable member for Dalley, as he knows. It is not based upon, the idea that he lacks the ability to perform the functions of the Chair, because everybody on this side of the Houserecognizes his ability, and acknowledges it freely. Our complaint is not, and never has been, based upon personal grounds. It is and has been based upon our belief that, in a Parliament constituted as this one is, as scrupulous fairness, should be observed in the treatment of both sides; and it is in order that we may have an opportunity of securing that treatment that we nominate the honourable member for Corangamite for the Chair, and invite the

Speaker: Mr CHIFLEY
Title: Unknown
text: Macquarie-Prime Minister and Treasurer) [2.40] - I support the nomination of the honourable member for Dalley (Mr.. Rosevear) for the position of Speaker in the belief that it is the. best that could be made. The honourable member, during his previous occupancy of the position, performed his duties most ably, and I repudiate the suggestion that be was other than impartial. During the r time that I have been a member of this Parliament no one has discharged the duties of Speaker with greater distinction, impartiality and ability than did the it con- honourable member for Dalley. text: May I inquire of you, Mr Clerk, what question will be put the event of this motion being carried ?

Title: Unknown
text: Paragrap h / of Standing Order 1 provides that when two or more nominations for the position of Speaker are before the House, and debate takes place, the Prime Minister may at any time move that the question be put. standing order then provides as follows:Upon the carrying of the Question " the Question be now put " , or upon the cessaHouse. tion of the debate otherwise, the election shall be proceeded with as provided in this Standing Order. In accordance with the S t and in g Orders the bells will be run g and ballot-papers will be d is t r i but e d to honourable members, each of w h o m will m a r k upon the paper AYES. handed to him the name of the candidate he desires to have elected. Question so resolved in the affirmative. The bells having been rung and a ballot having been taken,

Speaker: The CLERK
Title: Unknown
text: I have to announce the result of the ballot as follows:- Mr . Rosevear, 44 votes; Mr MCDonald, 29 votes. As the honourable member for Dalley has secured a majority of the votes of the members present, he is elected to the position of Speaker of this House. Members of the House then calling Mr. Rosevear to the chair, he was taken out of his place by Mr Mulcahy and Mr. Hadley and conducted to the Chair. Tellers :

Speaker: Mr SPEAKER
Title: Unknown
text: Hon. J. S. Rosevear). thank honourable members for having again conferred on me the high and honourable office of Speaker of this NOES. House. Mr Speaker having seated himself in the chair.

Speaker: Mr CHIFLEY
Title: Unknown
text: On behalf of the members of the Government party in the House I extend to you, Mr. Speaker, our very warm congratulations on your election to the distinguished position of Speaker. Our experience of Tellers: your work in - this position during the last Parliament was that you did honourable service. You showed great capacity in the chair, and carried out the duties of the office in a manner that maintained the traditions of the great Speakers who in have gone before you. I extend to you, on behalf of honourable members, our congratulations.

Speaker: Mr MENZIES
Title: Unknown

Title: Unknown
text: Darling DownsLeader of the Australian Country party). - On behalf of my party, I congratulate you, Mr Speaker, on the overwhelming vote you received in the ballot. Not a single preference went astray. PRESENTATION TO THE GOVEBNOX

Title: Unknown
text: I have ascertained that it will he the pleasure of His Royal Highness the Governor General to receive you, Mr Speaker, in the Parliamentary Library immediately.

Speaker: Mr SPEAKER
Title: Unknown
text: I shall be glad if as. many honourable members as can do so will attend with me, when I wait on His Royal Highness.

Speaker: Mr SPEAKER
Title: Unknown
text: I have to report that, accompanied by honourable members, I proceeded to the Library of the Parliament and presented myself to H is Royal Highness the Governor General as the choice of the House, and that Hi s Royal Highness was kind enough to congratulate me on my election as Speaker. The USHER OV THEBLACK ROD being announced, was admitted, and delivered a message that His Royal Highness the Governor General desired the attendance of honourable members in the Senate chamber forthwith. Mr Speaker and honourable attended accordingly and, having returned, NA

Speaker: Mr SPEAKER
Title: COMMISSION TO ADMINISTER
text: Hon. J. S. Rosevear). - I have received from His Royal High ness the Governor General a commission authorizing me to administer to members of the House the oath, or affirmation, of allegiance. I now lay the commission on the table. SECOND CHIPLEYMINISTRY .

Speaker: Mr CHLFLEY
Title: COMMISSION TO ADMINISTER
text: I formally announce that, on the 1st November, a new Ministry was formed, constituted as follows:Prime Minister and Treasurer-The Right Honourable J. B . Chifley. Attorney-General and Minister fo ternal Affairs-The Right Honorpreviously able H . "V. Evatt, LL . D ., D . KC. Minister for Labour and National SerG-ENEKAL. vice - The Honourable E. J. Holloway. Minister for A i r and Minister for Civil Aviation-The Honourable A . S. Drakeford. Vice-President of the Executive Council-The Honourable W. J . Scully. Minister for Supply and ShippingSenator the Honourable W. P. Ashley. Minister for Defence, Minister for Post-war Reconstruction and Minister in charge of the Council for Scientific and Industrial ResearchThe Honourable J . J . Dedman,. Minister for Transport and Minister for External Territories-The Honourable E . J . Ward. Postmaster-General-Senato r the Honourable D . Cameron. Minister for Information and Minister for Immigration-The Honourable A . A. Calwell. Minister for the Interior-The Honourable H . V . Johnson. Minister for Health and Minister for Social Services-Senato r the Honourable N . E . MCKenna. Minister for Commerce and Agriculture-The Honourable R. T. Pollard. Minister for Works and Housing-The members Honourable N . Lemmon. Minister for Munitions-Senato r the Honourable J. I . Armstrong. Minister for the Army-The Honourable C. Chambers. OATH. Minister for Trade and CustomsSenator the Honourable B . Courtice. Minister for the Navy-The Honourable W. J . F . Riordan. Minister for Repatriation-The Honourable H . C. Barnard. In addition to the duties associated with their portfolios, it has been arranged that the Minister for Health and Minister for Social Services (Senator MCKenna) will assist the Attorney-General and Minister for External Affairs (Dr Evatt ) in administering the office of Attorney General, and that the Minister for Works and Housing. (Mr Lemmon) will assist me in the office of Treasurer. The Department of A i r c r a ft Producr Extion has been abolished. The functions carried out by that departL it t ., ment will he the responsibility of the Department of Munitions. Senate Ministers will be represented in the House of Representatives as foi-. lows - The Minister for Health and Minister for Social Services will be represented by the Minister for Labour and National Service (Mr Holloway). The Minister for Supply and Shipping and the Minister for Munitions will be represented by the Minister for Defence, Minister for Post-war Reconstruction and Minister in charge of the Council for Scientific and Industrial Research (Mr. Dedman). The Postmaster-General will be represented by the Minister for Information and Minister for Immigration (Mr Calwell). The Minister for Trade and Customs will be represented by the Minister for Commerce and Agriculture  House of Representatives Ministers will he represented in the Senate as follows:-The Prime Minister, the Treasurer, the Minister for Labour National Service, and the Minister for Defence will'he represented by the Minister for Supply and Shipping (Senator Ashley). Minister for Social Services (Senator MCKenna). The Minister for Air, the Minister for Civil Aviation, and the Mr. Minister for Repatriation will be repreprepare sented by the Postmaster-General (Senadelivered tor Cameron). The Minister for Transthat port, the Minister for External Terrisitting. tories, the Minister for Immigration, the Minister for Information, and the Minister for "Works and Housing will be represented by the Minister for Munitions (Senator Armstrong). The Minister the Interior, the Minister for Commerce and Agriculture, and the Minister for the Army will be represented by the Minister for Trade and Customs (Senator Courtice). LEADER OF THE OPPOSITION.

Speaker: Mr MENZIES
Title: COMMISSION TO ADMINISTER
text: I have to announce that I have been elected Leader of the Opposition and Leader of the Liberal party of Australia, and the honourable member for Wentworth (Mr Harrison) Deputy Leader. NA COUNTRY PARTY.

Speaker: Mr FADDEN
Title: LEADER OF THE AUSTRALIAN
text: Darling DownsLeader of the Australian Country party). - I desire to inform you, Mr Speaker, and the House, that I have been elected Leader of the Australian Country party, and the honourable member for Indi (Mr. MCEwen) Deputy Leader.
